author: Andrea Thomas
title: Germany to Push for Exemptions From U.S. Sanctions on Russia
text:
BERLIN—German leaders want the Trump administration to exempt their country’s companies from tough new U.S. sanctions on Russia.
During a visit to Washington this week, Germany’s finance minister will push for special treatment and Chancellor Angela Merkel is planning to raise the issue with President Donald Trump when the two meet later this month, German officials said.

In... RELATED VIDEO Russia, a Poisoned Spy and a Global War of Words The deepening rift between Moscow and the West is raising tensions to levels not seen since the Cold War. Following a coordinated response by Western allies, scores of Russian diplomats and intelligence officers have been expelled. WSJ's Niki Blasina explains the escalating situation.
